Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: kate c
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a very handy area , near 2 tube stations and near Paddington train station. We were impressed with the cleanliness of the room and the bathroom. The man at the reception was very kind and changed our room on a lower floor when we requested. The breakfast staff always willing to serve with a nice smile. We have enjoyed our stay , and we will return with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Just glad we were only staying 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Greg P
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favour and give this place a miss. I now regret not consulting this website's reviews before deciding to book there. Although we didn't see any of the infamous cockroaches my wife spotted a "roach trap" placed in the hallway so clearly they do have "roach issues"! We had a room out the back below ground level which was small, dark and smelt of stale cigarette smoke. The bedsheets were ingrained with the stench of cigarettes and my pyjamas still stank when I got them home the following day. What's more we had an awful night's sleep because some inconsiderate residents were moving around and opening and closing doors at regular intervals throughout the night, and there didn't seem to be any staff around to do anything about it. The shower was good for 1 shower's worth of hot water and then it went cold. The only good thing is the location, and it's not like they're the only hotel in the area is it?

Reviews.Title: “Is this place still around???”
Reviews.Author: MaxxMontreal
Reviews.Content: For real? I stayed here about 7 years ago and it was the worst hotel ever, like something out of a movie. There was a cockroach in our room (and I see by other reviews here that they still have this problem). They blamed us for letting in cockroaches by leaving the window open (how else are we supposed to get fresh air in this hell hole). The room was tight and the bathroom even tighter. There are no elevators and the stairways are narrow. And the towels are not exactly the cleanest. Skip the breakfast buffet, it's down in the claustophobic basement and they're cheap. Actually, please skip this hotel altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at any cost”
Reviews.Author: Jonas E
Reviews.Content: To charge 62 pounds p.p. a night for a rat's nest like this should be criminal. The room was situated below ground level, with no natural light coming in. At night time we nearly froze to death in was they called a "bed". After a couple of nights sleeping in this hotel we began suffering from severe back pain. (Had to buy pain killers in the pharmacy). And they never changed the sheets. Bed spreads were discusting and itchy, probably around 30 years old and never washed. The room had virtually no shelves to put our stuff, so everything had to be put on the floor or on the bed. Shower was OK, but the water didn't get warm until after about 5 mins. Breakfast was a joke, and the "orange juice" looked radioactive... London hotels are usually a bit expensive, but for the price they charge at this hotel, you would at least expect a bit more effort. These people don't even try. Stay away from this place, please!

Reviews.Title: “Brilijant location, poor hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Faithz
Reviews.Content: Location is great, just a 5min walk from Paddington station. But the hotel.. change if you still can ;) We needed to report at a different hotel as there was no staff in our hotel. They have basement rooms, which seem like a broomcupboard! I requested something better and got a room on the second floor, which was somewhat better with the natural light comming in. I don't understand why they wanted me in the basement room while they had other rooms available. The room itself looks shabby, the wireless internet did not work in my room at all (though I had paid for it!). The bed wasn't too bad and the bathroom was ok. Breakfast was quite lousy and nothing continental about it, at all. I would defenitly stay somewhere else if I would visit this part of London again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: bardavon Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally situated for our 3 day 2 night stop in London .Our room was clean with what seemed like a recently refurbished bathroom.The room layout could have been better utilised with shelves in one of the alcoves where tea and coffee making facilities would have been welcomed. We were not overly concerned with the old portable television,{with remote that did not work} but the use of a wall mounted one would give more room for the shelving as mentioned earlier. If you are over a certain age or have any disability I would recommend you requested a ground floor room as it does not have a lift and even for a fit person carrying a large suitcase up three flights of stairs is hard work. The breakfast was as stated in the literature but small touches such as fresh, or even concentrated orange juice would have been better than the orange "squash" we had. I really would like to know who enjoy s cold hard boiled eggs ,sliced spam and thinly sliced cheese with very little flavour,for their breakfast as it is not one of my favourite ways to start the day.We chose to eat around the corner for our second day .

Reviews.Title: “A depressing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Joyday
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night on the way back from a trip to Paris but the comparison between the Beverley City and our lovely little hotel in Paris that cost nearly Â£20 per night less couldn't have been more marked. We had to report to the Nayland Hotel a couple of doors down to check in as there is no night time reception at the Beverley City. We were on the second floor and as there was no lift we had to carry our cases up to our room which was so dingy and outdated that we felt instantly depressed. Tobacco yellow walls with bedspreads circa 1980. The bathroom was small but very clean with a good shower allbeit connected up the wrong way round so that I stood 5 minutes waiting for hot water which I only got when I moved the dial over to cold! The breakfast was basic but ok though the orange juice was the worst I've ever tasted, even my husband agreeed and he'll drink anything! We've stayed in far better 3 star hotels in London than this one and overall I wouldn't be able to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back here”
Reviews.Author: lalouque
Reviews.Content: I guess it's on par with other hotels in this area. Not cheap, tiniest room I've ever seen, 10 Euros for internet access, lousy breakfast. The only good thing I have say about this hotel, it was 7 minute walk from Paddington station. You couldn't pay me to stay here again. I take that back. You could pay me, but it would need to be quite a bit of $$$. Just IMHO.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic room: quiet and fab position”
Reviews.Author: MojoBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This is what we expected. We had two adjacent rooms on first floor as travelling with kids. Rooms small and very basic but we were only sleeping there. Position absolutely fabulous. Caught the express train from airport to Paddington and walked from station with wheeled bags. Good cheap restuarants in the cross street. Would go there again on a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: selftraveller23
Reviews.Content: Less than 2 min walk to Paddington tube station was a perfect location in London. Room was not large but I must say it was extremely clean and it had a nice feel. Shower and toilet was as clean as new, I was impressed. I was most impressed with the staff they were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The continental breakfast it was as much as you could ask for...everything was fresh and the coffee really hit the spot! When reading Trip Advisor, I am frequently surprised by what people seem to expect from a small three star hotel. When I go on business trip I always travel 4 star, and there is a difference but I cannot expect as much when I pay myself and travel 3 or 2 stars. The Beverley city Hotel fulfilled my expectations. Overall very nice pleasant and peaceful stay, I will definitely return on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Aweful!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley121273
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with some colleague while on a 3 day business trip from Bristol. The hotel was arranged for us by the company that we work for; on previous occasions we have been put up in some fabulous hotels in Paddington however on this occasion we were to stay here. So I read some of the other reviews on here before checking in but I still checked in, optimistically. I really wish I had not bothered! The room was small but I could cope with it as it was just me - that was until I sat on the bed and was thrown to the other side of the room. The bed was on wheels! To get to my room I had to walk down some metal fire-escape type stairs which when I returned from dinner were wet (it had been drizzling) - when I slipped and landed at the bottom in a heap - nobody noticed I'd even fallen. When I complained, they looked at me blankly. I then had to complain to reception because the only way I could turn the lamp off at the bedside was by turning the entire electricity off in the room by removing my card! The switch was broken. I asked to be moved and they told me they were full! My colleague had to leave the hotel at 10pm at night and at his own expense had to check into another hotel because his bed was covered in bedbugs when he arrived back from dinner! He complained to reception and the only excuse/apology he got was "We are fully booked". I really would not recommend this hotel to anybody and will be reporting them - if you want my opinion, stay somewhere else! It's not worth the hassle of staying here!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL ..VERY CLEAN AND FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: Kyriacos2011
Reviews.Content: Small Hotel but all staff are very friendly, good location . Clean and good service

Reviews.Title: “Nice holidays, enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: mary2099
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Beverley hotel. Small hotel with very friendly staff and good value for money. The location is very good, so close to the station and very good connection with the rest of the city as well as Heathrow airport. It was all great, clean rooms, clean shower , nice breakfast but best of all - the staff. Just after a couple of stays they remembered my name and they always had great advice on how to get to places I needed and were more than happy to print me a map whenever I asked for one.. We enjoyed our stay and we will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gethom92
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised, given the reviews I had read. This hotel is very well situated, close to Paddington station and to many restaurants shops and bars. We arrived at the hotel a bit early and the friendly receptionist let us store our luggage. Our room was located on the front side of the hotel with a huge window almost 3m high overlooking at Sussex gardens, the room and bathroom were clean. The breakfast was very good for continental breakfast. There was a good variety of items to choose from and everything was fresh. We definitely return back in our next trip to London

Reviews.Title: “Nice !! Cleanliness, good location , Friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: MaryGeorgiadou
Reviews.Content: Arrived in London and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful! They even direct us to the hotel when we got lost . The room was very clean nicely decorated and had all necessary amenaties. Great location 5 minutes from Paddington station close to oxford street , it was great to combine business and leisure !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Basel1297
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. We arrived and the friendly young man at the desk checked us in and took us to our rooms which were cosy, very clean and both had ensuite bathrooms. The continental buffet breakfast, it was good, adequate for the morning start. Most importantly the place was very clean, something you can't take for granted. Great location, very close to Paddington station and Lancaster gate which made it easy for us to go shopping and sightseeing. There are also a lot of restaurants and pubs in the neighbourhood, so you have a lot of choice. All in All, hotel is good value for money and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: kathy8945
Reviews.Content: Stay away! Donâ€™t book this hotel. The only good thing that I can say is that this is a charming looking hotel on a beautiful street only two blocks from Paddington Station. When we arrived at the hotel around 11:00 a.m., the door was locked and a note said to go to their sister hotel 5 doors down the street. A clerk then walked us back and let us leave our luggage there until check-in later that afternoon. We are two senior ladies and had to take our own suitcases down to a basement room by a staircase with a curve at the top and a handrail at the halfway point. We asked for a room with two beds and were given a double bed. The room was so small that we could only open the bathroom door partway because it was blocked by the bed. The bathroom was so tiny that you have to slide onto the toilet under the sink. There was black mold spots in the grout in the shower stall. In order to wash your face in the sink you must keep the bathroom door open so that you can bend over. We left our dingy towels on the bathroom floor and when we returned later that day, they were hanging on the hook on the back of the bathroom door. After going to the reception desk to ask for clean towels, we were told that they were at their sister hotel down the street. When asked if we had to go get them, the clerk did volunteer to get them for us but asked what size we wanted. There was no hotpot or tea in the room. The TV was old, only could get 3 channels, the remote didnâ€™t work, and there was no place to sit in the room except on the bed to watch it. Breakfast consisted of Tang or water, coffee from a pot that hadnâ€™t been washed in ages, cereal with milk, dry sliced cheese, some sort of luncheon meat, bread to be toasted, and some hardboiled eggs that had been sitting out on the table for who knows how long. This is the worst hotel I have ever been in!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel Terrible Breakfast, DO NOT STAY”
Reviews.Author: tjbrown031184
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romanitc weekend, It did not go well first we were confronted by a confusing sign telling us that the reception was closed and we had to go to the next door Nayland hotel? next we saw our room which was down in the basement, it was cramped and smelled strongly of smoke, we complained and luckily got moved the next room was better but still very small and smelled of bleach instead! Needless to say we went out and only slept here, on the plus side it had a reasonable shower. Breakfast which, i hasten to add you pay extra for was pretty ropey and hugely overcrowded with everyone fighting for the same pot of coffee! there was cold lunceon meat, toast and cheese, hardly the fryup you expect! my girlfriend and I gave up complaining and just looked at each other and laughed. My advice-if you secretly hate your partner and want to say it in a subtle way, then the Beverly City Hotel is your place, If not then AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary6930
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 5 minutes walk from Paddington station, so it was great for us getting in from the airport. As soon as we got there we liked the feel of this small hotel. The room wasn't large but it was really nice, very clean and the bed supercomfortable. We have stayed in London before always choosing 3 star hotels and the Beverley is probably the nicest we have stayed in. Also Breakfast was more than we expected with fresh boiled eggs, cheese and ham, very nice! We stayed over the weekend for two nights and we will go back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: murielDublin
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a room on the fourth floor. There was no lift. We requested a room at a lower level and were given one on the ground floor. It was a very small dark room at the back of the building. We had to leave the light on and the curtains pulled as other guests passed the window to get to their rooms further back in the building. The bathroom was adequate in size. The ceiling and some of the wall tiles had black spots on them as there was no air extractor fan. The grouting in the shower and shower door was dirty and mouldy. The t.v. did not work. We reported it. It was not fixed. Breakfast was from 7 a.m. to 9 a.m. The breakfast room was small and crowded with tables. If all the tables had been occupied at the same time, no one would be able to move. Guests had to get off their chairs to allow guests at adjoining table to pass. The orange juice provided was just coloured water - it had been so diluted with water. No tea provided. A notice in the reception area described the breakfast as "rich". There was no information provided about what to do in case of a fire. We did not see any fire escape. There was only one exit for us to use, in case of an emergency. We asked for a second key but it was policy to only give one key per room. We would not recommend it to anyone. We were so happy when our stay there ended.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for young people and couples not looking for luxury, terrible for families”
Reviews.Author: ELZOHEIRY
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff are almost friendly. Location is good but there's better. Rooms are very small (thank God I'm not tall or else I would've suffered). Breakfast is simply boiled eggs, cheese, jam, cereals, juice, coffee and tea. Would recommend it for young people that just need a clean place to sleep in and for young couples who need to save money for other more useful purposes. London is AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: “happy , it did the job”
Reviews.Author: irish1213134
Reviews.Content: We went on a short five day trip , on arrival we found the desk manned by helpful a man the desk is not manned 24 hours but help is available from a desk 50 m up the road , the room was small but clean tv , hair dryer , but no kettle which would have been nice for tea or coffee . bathroom was very small but it did the job, shower was excellent with plenty of hot water . the walls can be bit thin . from what i could see of other rooms they are all on the small side . breakfast was my biggest crib , eggs, cold meats, cheese or cereal was on menu but the room was tiny for the amount of people staying. if i was returning this is the only thing that would put me off . traffic noise was non existent however we could hear the tube as it is quite close but not loud enough to be a bother .and it stops at around 12pm the area seems quite safe , the tube is about 2 -3 min walk from the hotel . there are a few shops , MacDonalds KFC and a few pups restaurants. if you feel like a Chinese do not go to the one near the padigton Hilton as it is rotten , it is better to go to china town , over all we were satisfied the room is small but clean but the location is very good the staff are friendly , as a base to do some site seeing and to rest at night it is a good choice .

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst hotel experience of our lives!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scousechicks
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a double room for one night to go to a concert, we got there to find a note on the door which told us to check in at the neyland so with are luggage and in the rain we did so! Not a good start!!! The girl took one look at us and as we are both females gave us a twin room when it clearly stated on the booking confirmation double!!! The twin room (which was in the basement next to the toilets and breakfast room ) was so small there was no room for the luggage! The worst thing about this room was the smell in the bathroom, i think it was the drains as it was clean. It wasn't so bad when we first checked in but when we woke up and went into the bathroom the pair of us were almost sick and had to get out!! We went to the breakfast room for a cup of tea.... was none!!!! So had a glass of orange cordial, no pure orange only coffee!! We explained to the man on reception at 8am when he was finally there and he said nobody has complained about this smell before (this is very hard to believe) and he said sorry!! We checked out at 8.15am and went for breakast with our cases in toe elsewhere. DO NOT STAY HERE, EVEN A NIGHT IS TOO LONG!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: winemanscotland Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Not a big room, checkin smooth, showers excellent, bit much traffic noise for my liking, but you can get this in more expensive hotels too, so overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, clean and no supplement for English Breakfast !!”
Reviews.Author: globlatravel
Reviews.Content: I am often in London for business 1/2 days a mounth and I found my stay ay Beverley very pleasant, excellent location just a short walk from the tube, enlgish breakfast with bolied eggs and ham and cheese included in the room rates most hotels ask for supplement... more I found the receptionist staff very helpful and on the first nught they book for me a very good Greek restaurant. Rooms are not huge but keept very clean along with the bathroom. I would reccomend this hotel as "pied a terre" to visit london for both business and pleasure. I will come back !! Marco, Italy

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: somersetwest09
Reviews.Content: The only plus side is the location. Negative points 1 Reception non existence. sit and watch TV or playing games and refuse to help at all. Leaves desk at eight at night then you are stuck. On departure the reception refused to contact taxi service so had to stand in the main road with all luggage to obtain taxi service by stopping taxi as they drive by. Two elderly ladies had to carry their luggage down flights of stairs as the reception refused to render any assistance. 2 Rooms terrible stale and not ventilated. Had to finish making up the bead one day out of the 4 days as the bedspread was bundled up in the corner of the room. (this was at nine in the evening on our return to the hotel) Single bed linen on double bed does nor work. We slept more on the mattress as on the sheets and on top of it all the linen had holes in it as well. 3 Breakfast What a disaster This hotel do not understand the meaning of continental breakfast. What you get is - A water downed artificial juice which tasted like nothing ever tasted before. - Over Boiled cold eggs as blue as it can be. - Cerials with no taste at all. - Cheese (one variate) slivers so thin that in the event of lifting them they tare apart. - Meat slivers from the lowest grade and standard possible. - Only sliced bread which you had to toast yourself no other option of buns or muffins, fresh fruit or even yogurt available. - One platter of the same cheese and meat every day - Dining room without table cloths and packed with to many tables and chairs for you to move around when 50 % occupied. In conclusion The world rate South Africa as a 3rd world BUT I can assure you that our one star Hotels are better than this three star dump (hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, decent price”
Reviews.Author: leefacanada
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to spend our night in transit back to Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for my 24-hour layover”
Reviews.Author: ALBinWDC
Reviews.Content: I had a short layover in London on my way home to the US. It was decent enough for my needs -- clean, well kept, and most importantly for me, it was just around the corner from Paddington station where I had direct access to Heathrow via the Heathrow Express. The major drawback, though tolerable for my circumstance, was the lack of elevator. My room was small but since I was alone, I could deal with it. Had there been 2 of us, no way!! I concur with other reviewers about the breakfast. Also, there was no air conditioning. For me, not a big deal as I prefer fresh air. Would I stay there again? Possibly. I think if the hotel offered an in-room mini fridge to where I could store beverages and restaurant leftovers for later snacking, I would be more inclined.

Reviews.Title: “Won't come back”
Reviews.Author: Mopa1009
Reviews.Content: I booked The Beverley City hotel as a last minute act of panic. I wish I had chosen any other London hotel. The room was tiny, had a bad smell, the bathroom was filthy (and unhealthy, I am sure), and the breakfast was poor. They ran out of bread 20 minutes before the breakfast ended, and provided no alternatives - there was nothing else to eat.

Reviews.Title: “What a cute little place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LynnieAus
Reviews.Content: I loved this little hotel! It is easy to find from Paddington station (walking distance) so is very easy to get to from Heathrow airport. It is one little hotel in several similar hotels all in a row, set back from the street. There is no lift so pack light! The hallways, stairwells and rooms are very small and 'English' and I loved that. We stayed in a room for two and you wouldn't have fit three people in the room but it was cosy! The rooms are clean and tidy and the bathroom is tiny but functional. It's not for the fussy travellers because of its size, but we are not very fussy and we loved it! would definately stay there again. There is also a cute little breakfast room downstairs which was excellent too!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute dump”
Reviews.Author: qwertySydney
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel! We made the mistake of booking 5 nights here and it was so bad that we left after the first night. In no particular order, the bad points are: 1. There is no lift or elevator so if you have large suitcases and are staying on the higher floors, you will either have to lug them up to your room yourself or pay some poor cleaner 5 pounds to help you. The guy at reception will not help in any way. 2. The rooms are TINY - one person and one suitcase cannot fit in a twin room at the same time. Also, two single beds will only fit in a twin room if they are pushed together, so don't expect any personal space at night... 3. Supposedly 'non-smoking' room smelt terribly of stale cigarettes. 4. Guy at reception goes home at 6pm so if you need assistance after that time, you are out of luck! 5. There is no ventilation so the rooms are very stuffy. 6. There is no 'full English Breakfast' - what you get is reconstituted orange juice, thin pieces of toast and fake jam-type substance to put on it. This place is like many others near Paddington Station - an overpriced dump masquerading as a hotel. Read the other reviews and consider yourself warned!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, terrible breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LEASMITH
Reviews.Content: Beverley house hotel is the equivalent of a two star property. The ensuite room was average with a small but clean bathroom. The bed was nice and comfortable. However no tea or coffee making facilities and it is a shame the room was not as clean as the bathroom! The breakfast is the worst breakfast i have ever had in any B and B or hotel-watered down cordial orange juice and the choice of three cereals- all of which were very untasty. The hotel is in a pleasant location, near to Lancater Gate tube for easy accessibility around London.

HotelInfo.Name: Beverley City Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 142 Sussex Gardens, London W2 1UB, England
